IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Provide teams to teach "English as a Foreign Language"
IRS990.MissionDesc: ELIC places passionate people in contact with students across Asia through the medium of teaching English. ELIC recruits, trains, and sends men and women from the U.S. and Canada to meet the ever-growing demand for quality English education in Asia.
IRS990.Desc: ELIC has been sending teachers to teach English in China, Southeast Asia, and the Middle East/North Africa since 1982. We are considered the premier English teaching organization. ELIC receives funding for carrying out programs in three ways: 1) teachers raise support to cover programmatic costs directly related to their services overseas; 2) ELIC affiliates pay ELIC a fee for carrying out administrative and support services for programs; and 3) ELIC is paid by overseas Universities for the placement of teachers and carrying out specific summer programs. In 2022, ELIC placed 340 teachers overseas. 258 were annual assignments while 82 were summer assignments.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: Grants to Recipients Located in Region
Grants to Recipients Located in Region

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ELIC works closely with foreign organizations that have the same purpose as ELIC. As part of working with these organizations in North America, Asia, and Middle East and North Africa, ELIC monitors the use of granted funds.
Foreign expenditures are accounted for based on the accrual accounting basis, using expense reports and other appropriate documentation.
Schedule F Part II is showing three separate grants, two of which went to the same foreign 501(c)(3) equivalent located in two separate regions.
Grants were made to related organizations with common management. Therefore, ELIC's Director of Finance has full access to the accounting records at the grantee organizations.

Pursuant to Internal Revenue Code Section 107, ministerial housing allowances are provided for qualifying ministerial employees. This is not included in taxable compensation. The President met the qualifications for and received a ministerial housing allowance during the tax year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee is composed of the Chairman, Vice Chair, and one other Board Member. The Executive Committee has authorization to act on behalf of the Board in between meetings.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the Director of Finance. A copy of the return was provided to the Chairman of the Audit Committee and the Executive Committee for any comments. In addition, a copy of the return was provided to the full Board prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board members and officers are required to disclose potential conflicts of interest on an annual basis. The annual signed disclosures are reviewed by the Vice Chair. The Vice Chair's disclosure is reviewed by the President. Additionally, the executive & finance teams meet regularly and monitor transactions to make sure they comply with the conflict of interest policy. If there is a potential conflict of interest, the person with a conflict recuses himself from the board's decision making process. No transaction is entered into unless it is determined to be in the best interest of ELIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The independent board is responsible for annually establishing the President's compensation. The Vice President of Human Resources compiles a compensation analysis using comparability data from various sources and presents this information to the board. The independent board then examines the data and votes to approve the compensation of each officer. This process is documented in the board minutes. Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15b: Compensation for other officers is determined by an annual review of similar sized nonprofit and for-profit entities. The compensation was reviewed and approved by the President, and the process is documented in the applicable personnel file.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VII and Schedule J:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation reported in Part VII, column D and Schedule J, Part II, column B is the amount reported on the individual's W-2, box 1 or 5 (whichever amount is greater) per the IRS instructions. In the case of minister's compensation when box 5 of the W-2 is not applicable, box 1 compensation is used. Employee deferrals to qualified retirement plans are normally captured in box 5, not box 1 of Form W-2. For reporting purposes we have included the minister's retirement plan deferrals in Part VII, column F and Schedule J, Part II, column C.
Change in net assets of subsidiaries -3,802,043.
